column4: does anyone know why network manager or my network connection in general would just disconnect and stop working unless i restart whenever i'm downloading something using bittorrent? it seems to do it faster the higher my download speed. my wireless card is a Broadcom Corporation BCM4311, if that helps.
Wireless tends to have more issues with high traffic.  Do you know if the router is crashing or just your adapter?
just the adapter. the router stays up, and other computers are unaffected. once i restart, it's back to normal.
what bittorrent application are you using
I would lower the values of the connection settings to prevent azureus from overloading your adapter
Do you know how to adjust Azureus settings?
sort of. what exactly should i adjust?
I think lowering max connections to 60 should help the most
Do you know if DHT is enabled.  DHT uses a ton of traffic to communicate with peers, I would try disabling that.
where would i find that in the options?
Go to Tools -> Options -> Plugins -> Distributed DB
done. i'm turning off my max upload and download speeds to see if it breaks again.
it seems to be working. thanks for your help!
